author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
A brewer's brew, gallant Bud Light, once favored and pure,
A boy named Dylan's mischief, an unfortunate lure.
Trading favor for scorn, profits lamentably dive,
In the heart of the states, AB InBev fights to survive.

The stolid German trader, his exports lacking pace,
His coffers blossom larger, as demand doth grimly brace.
Yet midst the sluggish currents, a rare solace he finds,
In the fickle siren song of the market's changing winds.

In the land of Nintendo, the trumpet of profit roars,
On success of Mario's film and Zelda's mythic lores.
Whilst the world's gold alters course as capricious as the seasons,
Their fortunes rise on dreams spun by digital minstrels' reasons.

feedItems.title: Bud Light Boycott Sparks Big U.S. Profit Drop for AB InBev
feedItems.description: The brewing giant lost market share after the Dylan Mulvaney debacle, but it says consumers remain favorable toward Bud Light.

feedItems.title: German Exports Remain Sluggish as Trade Surplus Grows
feedItems.description: German exports rose just 0.1% on month in June, though the country’s trade balance was boosted by even weaker imports, suggesting increasingly squeezed demand.

feedItems.title: Nintendo's Profit Rose on 'The Legend of Zelda' Game, Mario Film Successes
feedItems.description: The videogame maker maintained its forecasts for Switch consoles and software sales as well as for fiscal-year earnings.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In wait-and-see stance, bond markets do lie,
Says Generali, with an attentive eye.
Whilst inflation's fell swoon doth slowly fade,
Resilient U.S. yields a contrary trade hath made.

BMW's earnings, 2023 the year,
Do herald a decrease most severe.
Yet hope glimmers in shadows cast,
With solid growth in deliveries forecast.

Rebound in China, Adidas' delight,
Once again, it takes flight.
Profit made in quarter two,
Though the annual loss doth continue to accrue.

feedItems.title: Bond Markets Remain in Wait-And-See Mode
feedItems.description: Government bond markets are in wait-and-see mode, Generali Investments said, adding that while inflation rates should continue to decline moderately, the resilient U.S. economic data and 10-year yields well below the policy rate argue against a noticeable decline in yields in the short term.

feedItems.title: BMW Warns on 2023 Pretax Earnings
feedItems.description: BMW guided for a significant decrease in group earnings before tax for 2023, but said it now expects solid solid growth in deliveries to customers worldwide this year.

feedItems.title: Adidas Cuts Forecast Loss as China Leads Rebound
feedItems.description: Adidas was back in profit in the second quarter, helped by a recovery in China and easing of inventories, and forecast a narrower operating loss for the year of €450 million.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In Bev’s venture through a summer's quarter did fair,
With organic growth and earnings rare.
Guidance held steady, an incremental scare
Cast aside, runneth shares through the market’s lair.

Infineon's outlook, a steady third phase,
In mixed market’s dance, their guidance embraced.
Revenue aligned, forecasts thus graced,
A steady ship sailing, not a moment misplaced.

ING’s wealth leaps, amidst season's bloom,
Net profit soars, silencing gloom.
Retail and wholesale, in tandem, consume,
A jump in coinage - prosperity loom.

feedItems.title: AB InBev Delivers Solid 2Q With Absence of Negatives
feedItems.description: AB InBev delivered a solid enough second quarter, with organic Ebitda and headline EPS above expectations and its Ebitda guidance range maintained—so the absence of any incremental negatives should be enough to drive shares higher, Citi said.

feedItems.title: Infineon Outlook on Track After In-Line Third Quarter
feedItems.description: Infineon backed its guidance for the year after posting third-quarter revenue and a segment result that met forecasts, despite mixed demand.

feedItems.title: ING Outperforms as Revenue Jumps
feedItems.description: ING reported a jump in net profit for the second quarter to €2.2 billion as revenue rose 23%, with income growth in both retail and wholesale banking.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the realm of barley and of hop,  
AB InBev's sales did surely top.  
Yet from the West, a fall in sales,  
Their mighty ship battles gales.  

Lo, bold Lufthansa lifts its flight,  
In revenues, a welcome sight.  
Yet heavy costs weigh down their wings,  
In these tumultuous dealings of kings.  

From the bank with the General's name,  
Comes a profit casting off shame.  
Yet earnings fall, outlooks blur,  
In France's heart, financial stir.

feedItems.title: AB InBev Earnings Beat Hopes Despite Drop in US Volumes
feedItems.description: Anheuser-Busch InBev reported normalized earnings of $4.9 billion, slightly above forecast, as organic revenue grew 7.2%, and despite a steep drop in North America volumes.

feedItems.title: Lufthansa Boosted by Strong Demand But Costs Weigh
feedItems.description: Lufthansa’s second-quarter adjusted earnings almost tripled to €1.1 billion on a 17% rise in revenue, but its shares fell sharply, with Citi highlighting rising costs.

feedItems.title: Société Générale Profit Tops Hopes But Revenue Disappoints
feedItems.description: Société Générale swung to a second-quarter net profit from a year earlier but saw its revenue fall on lower net interest margin in France and a less conducive global banking environment.
